Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
RT @ryangrim: Incredible story from @DRBoguslaw on the UAW seriously outsmarting the automakers: 

CNBC reported, citing a "source familiar with the UAW strategy," a list of plants that they said the UAW planned to strike. 

The Big Three moved a bunch of engines around and shut down various plants to anticipate it. 

They were wrong on every count, and, at great expense, moved engines from plants that didn't strike to plants that did strike. 

Total fail by the executives, which allowed the UAW to paralyze their operations while still sending most of their members to work, conserving the strike fund. 

CNBC was cribbing from a trade publication, which probably got their information from some strike-breaking consultant -- who was clearly played for a fool by the UAW.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
There are many reasons for this, one being that the baby boomer gen changed a lot of the norms & structures of Congress (schedule, staff, cola, etc) so the actual job became very unsustainable for newer people who are younger, working class, or parents.

Drives away young talent

Name: Paul Kane
Text:
Pretty great visual look at how Congress keeps getting older -- even as each newly elected class includes younger folks. The 2022 class had 18 new reps under 40.
But older incumbents stick around longer.

Via @nckmourt & @D_Hawk 

https://t.co/ReSasAmcUc

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
Even simple things like how votes are scheduled (& changed) are often hostile to parents and families.

A lot of small details in this job is pretty much assumes you have a full-time, stay at home spouse. Which makes sense, because many/most did! But if you don‚Äôt, it‚Äôs a problem

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
If a member is independently wealthy (which many are), it can create a ton of blind spots for all these details that build up, or even resistance to changing them.

But I think the people who get elected from more normal backgrounds do run into a bit of shock when they get here

Name: Safety
Text:
More than 99% of content users and advertisers see on Twitter is healthy.

And the reach of hate speech on Twitter continues to represent an extremely small fraction of the overall conversation.

This past March, Twitter partnered with Sprinklr to understand, measure and reduce hate speech using its AI-based model and to further our commitment to create a brand-safe environment for our agencies and advertisers.

Today we‚Äôre sharing an update that includes all of April and May 2023.

Sprinklr‚Äôs independent model continues to show the reach of daily English-language hate speech impressions is even lower than Twitter‚Äôs own model estimates.

Sprinklr estimates the average daily number to be 0.003% compared to Twitter‚Äôs estimate of 0.012% for the period of January 1, 2023 to May 31, 2023. Additionally, we estimate hate speech impressions are 30 percent lower on average vs. pre-acquisition.

In June we significantly expanded our Freedom of Speech, Not Reach policy enforcement, which dramatically reduces impressions on harmful content. And all indicators for June and July show sustained progress.

Our work is ongoing and we‚Äôre proud of the progress we‚Äôre making in maintaining a healthy global town square that is open for everyone to be themselves.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
It is very important to note this SCOTUS ruling does NOT remove Biden‚Äôs ability to pursue student loan forgiveness.

The Biden Admin can use the HEA (Higher Ed Act) - our position from the start - to continue loan forgiveness before payments resume. They should do so ASAP.

Name: Steven Mazie
Text: BREAKING: the Supreme Court STRIKES DOWN President Biden's student-debt-relief plan by a 6-3 vote. The plan is not authorized by the HEROES Act‚Äîthe law relied upon by Biden's education secretary.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
Just last year, DOE forgave $6 BILLION for defrauded students. Trump completely wiped out debt for disabled veterans. Neither program was challenged nor overturned.

We still have the power to cancel and must use it, or we‚Äôre looking at an economic crisis for millions of people.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
Justice Alito accepted tens of thousands of dollars in lavish vacation gifts from a billionaire who lobbied to cancel the student loan forgiveness.

After the gifts, Alito voted to overturn. This SCOTUS‚Äô corruption undercuts its own legitimacy by putting its rulings up for sale.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
Here‚Äôs the deal: McCarthy has nowhere near the votes for a deal and therefore cannot negotiate debt ceiling.

You need 218 votes. GOP has maybe ~150. They will need anywhere from 50-100 House Dems to pass anything.

Dems have 213 votes for a clean bill & just need to pick up 5.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
We got a preview of this during McCarthy‚Äôs disaster of Speaker vote in January. He doesn‚Äôt know how many votes he has on what. That‚Äôs what makes this ‚Äúnegotiating‚Äù rudderless.

How do you deal with someone who cannot deliver passage? Clean bill needs 5. He can‚Äôt pass without Dems

Text:
When I opposed this Amazon project coming to New York bc it was a scam of public funds, the whole power establishment came after us.

Billboards went up in Times Sq denouncing me. Powerful pols promised revenge. Op-Eds & CEOs insulted my intelligence.

In the end, we were right.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
The effort to separate the officers who murdered Tyre Nichols from the system of policing that produced them is palpable.

Police killings in the US reached a record high in 2022. That has only been rewarded with more funding at the expense of schools, hospitals, housing, & more.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
Tyre Nichols should be alive. Charges alone aren‚Äôt justice. Change is.

At least 1,176 people were killed by law enforcement last year - a record. Billions in trainings, body cams, and reforms haven‚Äôt stopped it. In fact, it‚Äôs gotten worse. We must grow out of this cycle together

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
Been there. This is one of many ways Congress structures itself to exclude and push out the few working class people who *do* get elected.

These systems are built for people who can lean on wealth. It‚Äôs shocking how detached from reality a lot of the details are - but I got you!

Name: Maxwell Alejandro Frost
Text:
Just applied to an apartment in DC where I told the guy that my credit was really bad. He said I‚Äôd be fine. Got denied, lost the apartment, and the application fee. 

This ain‚Äôt meant for people who don‚Äôt already have money.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:
And don‚Äôt let people make you feel bad about your credit. It doesn‚Äôt speak to your character or worth.

A lot of folks don‚Äôt know the US credit system is not objective or reliable. It is designed to be deeply slanted against working people.

Name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Text:

1. Your first paycheck comes in Feb. You need to work for a full month in a new city before getting paid. Your 1st month you have to pay work-required DC rent, home rent, living expenses, and furnishings w/ no income

RT @LaurenKGurley: BREAKING: 48K University of Calfornia TAs, postdocs & other student workers just walked off the job. 

It's the largest strike in the US since 2019. 

Many UC workers earn < $24k/yr. A PhD student I spoke to said they donate blood plasma to make ends meet.
https://t.co/RVI7e1xchT
